course.title: Python and Django Full Stack Web Developer Bootcamp
course.subtitle: Learn to build websites with HTML , CSS , Bootstrap , Javascript , jQuery , Python 3 , and Django!

reviews.body: One of the best courses in Udemy by far! Great course content with lots of walk through examples and hands-on. And on top of that it has an excellent instructor!

Great Course! I surely could understand every topics and enjoy it. I just suggest one thing: The course is not for total beginners because it can be frustrated for most of them to read the official documentation of Django. Why?, because the course is outdated.

The lecture was very good but many packages details were missed may be bacause they require separate expalnation and would have made course long. But if that was included would have helped to get the content more easily yes time consuming but more relevent.

Thanks Jose for the in-deep walkthrough web development with Django in python.

I can only provide positive appreciations for this course. well structured, lots of relevant examples and excellent explanation. I recommend this course although further development of skills is needed to be a complete full-stack. Farewell.

There is a lot in this course and he covered them all very well. The good part is ,everything he live coded and that make things clear .I feel this course gave me way more knowledge than i paid for this.Thanks a lot jose for publishing this course.

The course has many vital subjects which are treated too hastily giving only poor explanations. This course is also very outdated since django was updated a lot already. This is hardly more than an introdutory course.

This course is actually good and easy to understand. However, this course is outdated. I had a lot of problems understanding the second half of the course. I don't recommend you to take this course at least by the time you read this review unless the course is updated in the future.

Covers a lot of content so that's good but needs to update to Django 3. I watched this while trying to create a project in Django 3 and was very confused. Would also be better if there was more explanation into how the code works instead of just teaching the "hows".

The course contains a lot of new and useful concepts for me and I'm grateful to Jose for creating the course. And after the course I feel I can make a simple Django project of my own, but of course I am not confident in Django.

But I would like there would be more explanations in the Social Media Site Clone Project not just retyping the code, but make the detail explanation of each method and concept with a link to documentation for self studying. Some questions about the course content remained unanswered.

Also, I wish the course contained more Home Work especially in the Django section of the course and It would be great if Jose update the course. The course was created in 2017 and some methods and concepts are obsolete in it.

I recommend the course for studying the basic concept of the web development with the Django framework
A little bit out of the last version of Django, still is good to learn how to handle the documentation, good exercises to practice
Basically, this course just like 'follow me typing the code'. It doesn't give enough explanation. After all, you need to figure out almost all the theory behind the code by yourself.

This was an excellent course.

The only problem is it's severely out of date and no attempts have been made to provide any supplemental materials to bridge the gap from Django 1 to Django 3.

If I have any criticisms of the teaching style it's mostly that in the latter Django projects the teacher goes through long stretches without running code or debugging. Combine that with the fact that he's using a much older version of Django and it's difficult to follow along.

On the plus side, if it were up to date, it's a very thorough course with detailed explanations and all the code is downloadable.

If the teacher updates it to Django 3, I'd certainly take it again.

instructor.name: Jose Portilla
instructor.briefIntroduction: Jose Marcial Portilla has a BS and MS in Mechanical Engineering from Santa Clara University and years of experience as a professional instructor and trainer for Data Science and programming. He has publications and patents in various fields such as microfluidics, materials science, and data science technologies. Over the course of his career he has developed a skill set in analyzing data and he hopes to use his experience in teaching and data science to help other people learn the power of programming the ability to analyze data, as well as present the data in clear and beautiful visualizations. Currently he works as the Head of Data Science for Pierian Data Inc. and provides in-person data science and python programming training courses to employees working at top companies, including General Electric, Cigna, The New York Times, Credit Suisse, McKinsey and many more. Feel free to contact him on LinkedIn for more information on in-person training sessions or group training sessions in Las Vegas, NV.
